field.documentation: Level 2 information describing how to retrieve the actual data for the UAL. Not to be filled/used by the ITM user !

field.name: putmethod
field.documentation: Storage method for this data

field.name: putaccess
field.documentation: Instructions to access the data using this method

field.name: putlocation
field.documentation: Name of this data under this method

field.name: rights
field.documentation: Access rights to this data

field.name: composition
field.documentation: Plasma composition (description of ion species).

field.name: amn
field.documentation: Atomic mass number (lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: zn
field.documentation: Nuclear charge (lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: zion
field.documentation: Ion charge (of the dominant ionisation state; lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: imp_flag
field.documentation: Multiple charge state calculation flag : 0-Only one charge state is considered; 1-Multiple charge state are considered and are described in impurity CPO; Vector (nion)

field.name: label
field.documentation: Label for the ions - note the charge state is not included; String Vector (nion)

field.name: desc_impur
field.documentation: Description of the impurities (list of ion species and possibly different charge states)

field.name: amn
field.documentation: Atomic mass number of the impurity; Vector (nimp)

field.name: zn
field.documentation: Nuclear charge of the impurity; Vector (nimp)

field.name: i_ion
field.documentation: Index of the impurity species in the coreprof ion species ordering. Vector (nimp)

field.name: nzimp
field.documentation: Number of charge states (or bundles) considered for each impurity species. Vector (nimp)

field.name: zmin
field.documentation: Minimum Z of impurity ionisation state bundle. Matrix (nimp,max_nzimp)

field.name: zmax
field.documentation: Maximum Z of impurity ionisation state bundle. If no bundle, zmax=zmin. Matrix (nimp,max_nzimp)

field.name: label
field.documentation: Label for the impurities - note that the charge state is not included; String Vector (nimp)

field.name: compositions
field.documentation: Contains all the composition information for the simulation (main ions, impurities, neutrals, edge species).

field.name: nuclei
field.documentation: Array of nuclei considered.

field.name: zn
field.documentation: Nuclear charge [units of elementary charge];

field.name: amn
field.documentation: Mass of atom [amu]

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying element (e.g. H, D, T, He, C, ...)

field.name: ions
field.documentation: Array of main plasma ions.

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: zion
field.documentation: Ion charge (of the dominant ionisation state; lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: imp_flag
field.documentation: Multiple charge state calculation flag : 0-Only one charge state is considered; 1-Multiple charge state are considered and are described in impurity CPO; Vector (nion)

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying ion (e.g. H+, D+, T+, He+2, C+, ...)

field.name: impurities
field.documentation: Array of impurities.

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: i_ion
field.documentation: Index of the impurity species in the coreprof ion species ordering. Vector (nimp)

field.name: nzimp
field.documentation: Number of charge states (or bundles) considered for this impurity species.

field.name: zmin
field.documentation: Minimum Z of impurity ionisation state bundle. Vector (nzimp)

field.name: zmax
field.documentation: Maximum Z of impurity ionisation state bundle. If no bundle, zmax=zmin. Vector (nzimp)

field.name: label
field.documentation: String array (nzimp) identifying impurities (e.g. C+, C+2 , C+3, C+4, C+5, C+6, ...)

field.name: neutralscomp
field.documentation: Array of neutrals.

field.name: neutcomp
field.documentation: Array of components to the atom or molecule. Vector (ncomp)

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: multiplicity
field.documentation: Multiplicity of the atom; int

field.name: type
field.documentation: Type of neutral, in terms of energy : 0=cold, 1=thermal, 2= fast, 3=NBI. Vector (ntype) of identifiers

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying the atom or molecule (e.g. D2, DT, CD4, ...)

field.name: edgespecies
field.documentation: Array of edge species.

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: zmin
field.documentation: Minimum Z of species charge state bundle

field.name: zmax
field.documentation: Maximum Z of species charge state bundle

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying the species (e.g. D0, D+, C0, C+, C+2, ...)

field.name: signature
field.documentation: Identifier for species choices. The goal of this is to uniquely capture the species blocks so that if the signatures are the same then the species blocks will also be the same.

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: values
field.documentation: Description of transport term coming from various origins. Array of structure (ntransp). Time-dependent

field.name: transportid
field.documentation: Identifier for the origin of the transport terms (see conventions in the ITM website)

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: rho_tor_norm
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal flux coordinate values (= rho_tor normalised to the value at the last grid point); Time-dependent; Vector (nrho)

field.name: rho_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate (not normalised, equivalent to rho_tor_norm) [m]; Vector (nrho). Time-dependent.

field.name: sigma
field.documentation: Parallel conductivity [ohm^-1.m^-1]. Time-dependent. Vector(nrho).

field.name: ni_transp
field.documentation: Transport coefficients for ion density equation. Time-dependent.

field.name: diff_eff
field.documentation: Effective diffusivity [m^2.s^-1]. The last index of the array describes which multiplier should be applied to the particule flux when adding its contribution in the expression of the heat flux : position 1 is multiplied by 0, 2 is multiplied by 3/2, 3 is multiplied by 5/2. The total particle flux (for the particle transport equation) is obtained as the sum over the three positions. Time-dependent. Array3d (nrho,nion,3)

field.name: vconv_eff
field.documentation: Effective convection [m.s^-1]. The last index of the array describes which multiplier should be applied to the particule flux when adding its contribution in the expression of the heat flux : position 1 is multiplied by 0, 2 is multiplied by 3/2, 3 is multiplied by 5/2. The total particle flux (for the particle transport equation) is obtained as the sum over the three positions. Time-dependent. Array3d (nrho,nion,3)

field.name: flux
field.unit: field.m.s^-1,.m^-3 if field is not a density itself
field.documentation: Flux. Not used in transport equations [field.m.s^-1,.m^-3 if field is not a density itself]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: off_diagonal
field.documentation: Details of the transport matrix, just for diagnostic (not used in transport equations). Time-dependent.

field.name: d_ni
field.documentation: Off-Diagonal term coupling ion density gradient to the transport equation [m.^2.s^-1]. Time-dependent. Array3d (nrho,nion,nion)

field.name: d_ti
field.documentation: Off-Diagonal term coupling ion density gradient to the transport equation [m.^2.s^-1]. Time-dependent. Array3d (nrho,nion,nion)

field.name: d_ne
field.documentation: Off-Diagonal term coupling electron density gradient to the transport equation [m.^2.s^-1]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: d_te
field.documentation: Off-Diagonal term coupling electron temperature gradient to the transport equation [m.^2.s^-1]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: d_epar
field.documentation: Off-Diagonal term coupling parallel electric field to the transport equation [m.^2.s^-1]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: d_mtor
field.documentation: Off-Diagonal term coupling total toroidal momentum to the transport equation [m.^2.s^-1]. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,nion)

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Flag describing the form of transport produced by the original model : 0- not calculated, 1- D and V, 2- flux, 3- full transport matrix. Scalar.

field.name: ne_transp
field.documentation: Transport coefficients for electron density equation. Time-dependent.

field.name: diff_eff
field.documentation: Effective diffusivity [m^2.s^-1]. The last index of the array describes which multiplier should be applied to the particule flux when adding its contribution in the expression of the heat flux : position 1 is multiplied by 0, 2 is multiplied by 3/2, 3 is multiplied by 5/2. The total particle flux (for the particle transport equation) is obtained as the sum over the three positions. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,3)

field.name: vconv_eff
field.documentation: Effective convection [m.s^-1]. The last index of the array describes which multiplier should be applied to the particule flux when adding its contribution in the expression of the heat flux : position 1 is multiplied by 0, 2 is multiplied by 3/2, 3 is multiplied by 5/2. The total particle flux (for the particle transport equation) is obtained as the sum over the three positions. Time-dependent. Matrix (nrho,3)

field.documentation: Code parameters

field.name: codename
field.documentation: Name of the code

field.name: codeversion
field.documentation: Version of the code (as in the ITM repository)

field.name: parameters
field.documentation: List of the code specific parameters, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_diag
field.documentation: List of the code specific diagnostic/output, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_flag
field.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values meaning some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used. Exact rules could discussed and implemented in the module wrapper. Time-dependent.

field.documentation: Index of the impurity species in the coreprof ion species ordering. Vector (nimp)

field.name: nzimp
field.documentation: Number of charge states (or bundles) considered for this impurity species.

field.name: zmin
field.documentation: Minimum Z of impurity ionisation state bundle. Vector (nzimp)

field.name: zmax
field.documentation: Maximum Z of impurity ionisation state bundle. If no bundle, zmax=zmin. Vector (nzimp)

field.name: label
field.documentation: String array (nzimp) identifying impurities (e.g. C+, C+2 , C+3, C+4, C+5, C+6, ...)

field.name: neutralscomp
field.documentation: Array of neutrals.

field.name: neutcomp
field.documentation: Array of components to the atom or molecule. Vector (ncomp)

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: multiplicity
field.documentation: Multiplicity of the atom; int

field.name: type
field.documentation: Type of neutral, in terms of energy : 0=cold, 1=thermal, 2= fast, 3=NBI. Vector (ntype) of identifiers

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying the atom or molecule (e.g. D2, DT, CD4, ...)

field.name: edgespecies
field.documentation: Array of edge species.

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: zmin
field.documentation: Minimum Z of species charge state bundle

field.name: zmax
field.documentation: Maximum Z of species charge state bundle

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying the species (e.g. D0, D+, C0, C+, C+2, ...)

field.name: signature
field.documentation: Identifier for species choices. The goal of this is to uniquely capture the species blocks so that if the signatures are the same then the species blocks will also be the same.

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: distri_vec
field.documentation: Vector over all distribution functions; Time-dependent. Structure array(ndistri_vec)

field.name: wave_id
field.documentation: List all waves affecting the distribution, as specified in waves(*)%coherentwave(*)%wave_id. Vector(n_antennas)

field.name: type
field.documentation: Identify the type of the object or process.

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: name
field.documentation: The name of the object or process. Here the object should be an instans of the type specified in the field type.

field.name: index
field.documentation: Index the separating objects or processes with the same name.

field.name: source_id
field.documentation: List all neutral beam injectors and reactions contributing to the source, as specified in distsource(*)%source(*)%source_id. Vector(n_injectors_and_reactions)

field.name: type
field.documentation: Identify the type of the object or process.

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: name
field.documentation: The name of the object or process. Here the object should be an instans of the type specified in the field type.

field.name: index
field.documentation: Index the separating objects or processes with the same name.

field.name: calc_spec
field.documentation: Pointer to the species for which the distribution function(s) is/are calculated and whose characteristics are given in composition (for ions). Value 0 means electrons.

field.name: gyro_type
field.documentation: Defines how to interpret the spatial coordinates: 1 = given at the actual particle position; 2 = given at the gyro centre of the particle position.

field.name: global_param
field.documentation: Global parameters (in most cases volume integrated and surface averaged quanatities).

field.name: n_particles
field.documentation: Number of particles in the distribution (note: this is the number of real particles and not markers); Time-dependent

field.name: enrg
field.documentation: Energy content of the distribution [J]; Time-dependent

field.name: enrg_para
field.documentation: Parallel energy content of the distribution [J]; Time-dependent

field.name: pow_coll_i
field.documentation: Collisional power to ions [W]; Time-dependent; Matrix(nion)

field.name: pow_coll_e
field.documentation: Collisional power to the electrons [W]; Time-dependent

field.name: therm_src
field.documentation: Source particles and power due to particles of the distribution species being thermalised (merging into the thermal plasma).

field.name: particles
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [1/s]; Time-dependedent

field.name: power
field.documentation: Power associated with the source/sink of particles [W]; Time-dependent

field.name: torque
field.documentation: Torque due to the source/sink of particles [N.m]; Time-dependent

field.name: losses
field.documentation: Losses of the distribution species (orbit losses and neutralisation losses).

field.name: orb_loss
field.documentation: Losses due to orbits intersecting a material surface.

field.name: particles
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [1/s]; Time-dependedent

field.name: power
field.documentation: Power associated with the source/sink of particles [W]; Time-dependent

field.name: torque
field.documentation: Torque due to the source/sink of particles [N.m]; Time-dependent

field.name: neutr_loss
field.documentation: Losses due to neutralisation of distribution ions (charge exchange etc.)

field.name: particles
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [1/s]; Time-dependedent

field.name: power
field.documentation: Power associated with the source/sink of particles [W]; Time-dependent

field.name: torque
field.documentation: Torque due to the source/sink of particles [N.m]; Time-dependent

field.name: cur_dr_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal current of non-thermal particles (excluding electron back current for fast ions) [A]; Time-dependent.

field.name: trq_i
field.documentation: Collisional torque to background ions [N.m]; Time-dependent; Vector (nion)

field.name: trq_e
field.documentation: Collisional torque to electrons [N.m]; Time-dependent

field.name: trq_j_rxb
field.documentation: Torque due to radial currents of non-thermal particles [N.m]; Time-dependent.

field.name: nucl_reac_th
field.documentation: Nuclear reactions between the calculated species and other species assumed to have thermal distributions.

field.name: rate
field.documentation: Reaction rate [1/s]; Time-dependent; Vector (nreac)

field.name: power
field.documentation: Fusion reaction power[W]; Time-dependent; Vector (nreac)

field.name: nucl_reac_sf
field.documentation: Nuclear reactions of the calculated species with itself (thermal + non-thermal).

field.name: rate
field.documentation: Reaction rate [1/s]; Time-dependent

field.name: power
field.documentation: Fusion reaction power[W]; Time-dependent

field.name: profiles_1d
field.documentation: Profiles (volume integrated and flux surface averaged)

field.name: rho_tor_norm
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal flux coordinate at the grid points for 1D profiles; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: rho_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate at the grid points for 1D profiles [m]. Defined as sqrt(phi/pi/B0), where B0 = equilibrium/global_param/toroid_field/b0. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: psi
field.documentation: Poloidal flux at the grid points for 1D profiles [Wb], without 1/2pi and such that Bp=|grad psi| /R/2/pi. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: dens
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged particle density of the distribution [J/m^3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: enrgd_tot
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged energy density of the distribution [J/m^3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: enrgd_para
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged parallel energy density of the distribution [J/m^3] Time-dependent; Vector (npsi).

field.name: powd_coll_i
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional power to ions [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Matrix (nion, npsi)

field.name: powd_coll_e
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional power to the electrons [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Vector(npsi)

field.name: therm_srcd
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged source of particles and power due to particles of the distribution species being thermalised (merging into the thermal plasma).

field.name: particlesd
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [s^-1 m^-3]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: powerd
field.documentation: Power density associated with the source/sink of particles [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: torqued
field.documentation: Torque density due to the source/sink of particles [N.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: lossesd
field.documentation: Particle loss densities due to charge exchange events with neutrals or orbits intersecting material surfaces.

field.name: orb_loss
field.documentation: Losses due to orbits intersecting a material surface.

field.name: particlesd
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [s^-1 m^-3]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: powerd
field.documentation: Power density associated with the source/sink of particles [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: torqued
field.documentation: Torque density due to the source/sink of particles [N.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: neutr_loss
field.documentation: Losses due to neutralised ions, e.g. due to charge exchange events.

field.name: particlesd
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [s^-1 m^-3]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: powerd
field.documentation: Power density associated with the source/sink of particles [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: torqued
field.documentation: Torque density due to the source/sink of particles [N.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: curd_fp
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged toroidal current density of non-thermal (fast) particles of the distribution species (excluding electron back current for fast ions) [A.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi).

field.name: curd_dr
field.documentation: Total toroidal driven current density (including electron back current in the presence of fast ions) [A]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: trqd_i
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional toroidal torque to background ions [N.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Matrix (nion, npsi)

field.name: trqd_e
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged collisional toroidal torque density to electrons [N.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: trqd_jrxb
field.documentation: Toroidal torque density due to radial currents of non-thermal particles of the distribution species [N.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: nucl_rd_th
field.documentation: Nuclear reaction rate densities for reactions between the cacluated species and other species assumed to have thermal distributions.

field.name: rated
field.documentation: Reaction rate [s^-1.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Matrix (nreac, max_npsi)

field.name: powerd
field.documentation: Nuclear reaction power density [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Matrix (nreac, max_npsi)

field.name: nucl_rd_sf
field.documentation: Nuclear reaction rate densities for reactions of the calculated species with itself (thermal + non-thermal).

field.name: rate
field.documentation: Reaction rate [s^-1.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Matrix (npsi)

field.name: power
field.documentation: Fusion reaction power [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Matrix (npsi)

field.name: enrg_tot
field.documentation: Energy content of of a distribution species [J] inside a flux surface; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: enrg_para
field.documentation: Parallel energy content of a distribution species [J] inside a flux surface; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: pow_coll_i
field.documentation: Collisional power to ions inside a flux surface [W]; Time-dependent; Matrix(nion, npsi)

field.name: pow_coll_e
field.documentation: Collisional power to the electrons inside a flux surface [W]; Time-dependent; Vector(npsi)

field.name: therm_src
field.documentation: Source particles and power inside a flux surface due to particles of the distribution species being thermalised (merging into the thermal plasma).

field.name: particles
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [1/s]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: power
field.documentation: Power associated with the source/sink of particles [W]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: torque
field.documentation: Torque due to the source/sink of particles [N.m]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: losses
field.documentation: Particle loss inside flux surface due to charge exchange events.

field.name: orb_loss
field.documentation: Losses due to orbits intersecting a material surface.

field.name: particles
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [1/s]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: power
field.documentation: Power associated with the source/sink of particles [W]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: torque
field.documentation: Torque due to the source/sink of particles [N.m]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: neutr_loss
field.documentation: Losses due to neutralised ions, e.g. due to charge exchange events.

field.name: particles
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [1/s]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: power
field.documentation: Power associated with the source/sink of particles [W]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: torque
field.documentation: Torque due to the source/sink of particles [N.m]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: cur_fp
field.documentation: Toroidal current of non-thermal (fast) particles driven inside a flux surface (does not include electron back current for fast ions) [A]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: cur_dr
field.documentation: Total toroidal current driven inside a flux surface (including electron back current in the presence of fast ions) [A]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi).

field.name: trq_i
field.documentation: Collisional toroidal torque to background ions inside a flux surface [N.m]; Time-dependent; Matrix (nion, npsi)

field.name: trq_e
field.documentation: Collisional toroidal torque to electrons inside a flux surface [N.m]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: trq_j_rxb
field.documentation: Toroidal torque due to radial currents of non-thermal particles of the distribution species [N.m]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: nucl_reac_th
field.documentation: Nuclear reactions inside a flux surface involving the distribution species and other species assumed to be thermal.

field.name: rate
field.documentation: Reaction rate [1/s]; Time-dependent; Matrix (nreac, npsi)

field.name: power
field.documentation: Fusion reaction power[W]; Time-dependent; Matrix (nreac, npsi)

field.name: nucl_reac_sf
field.documentation: Nuclear reactions inside a flux surface of the calculated species with itself (thermal + non-thermal).

field.name: rate
field.documentation: Reaction rate [1/s]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: power
field.documentation: Fusion reaction power[W]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: dist_func
field.documentation: Distribution functions. The total distribution total distribution can either be given by the a set of markers/test particles (in markers), or by a gridded function (dist_expand). Note that the gridded distribution can be written as sum of successive approximations, where each term is given by an element in the vector dist_expand. Finally, the distribution can be written as a sum of a marker distribution and a gridded distribution, e.g. for delta-f Monte Carlo solution.

field.name: is_delta_f
field.documentation: If is_full_f=1, then the distribution represents the deviation from a Maxwellian; is_full_f=0, then the distribution represents all particles, i.e. the full-f solution.

field.name: markers
field.documentation: Distribution represented by a set of markers (test particles).

field.name: variable_ids
field.documentation: Integer identification of the variables stored in the coord matrix. Vector(NDIM)

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: coord
field.documentation: Coordinates of the markers. The coordinates used is specified in variable_ids. Time-dependent; Float(NMARK,NDIM)

field.name: weight
field.documentation: Weight of the marker; number of real particles represented by the marker. Time-dependent; Float(NMARK)

field.name: f_expan_topo
field.documentation: TO BE REMOVED. KEPT TEMPORARILY AS AN ALTERNATIVE TO f_expansion. [Distribution function, f, expanded into a vector of successive approximations (topology-based formulation, without the grid-cpo). The first element in the vector (f_expansion(1)) is the zeroth order distribution function, while the K:th elemnet in the vector (f_expansion(K)) is the K:th correction, such that the total distribution function is a sum over all elements in the f_expansion vector. Time-dependent. Structure array(Nf_expansion)]

field.name: grid_info
field.documentation: Specification of grids used in topo_regions. Grid coordinates could either be invariants of motion, or information at single point along orbit, e.g. xi and s for grid_coord=3. This point should always be on a so-called omnigenous surface (a generalised equitorial plane); grad(psi) x grad(B) = 0. All closed orbits cross omnigenous surfaces at least two times. The omnigenous surfaces are described in omnigen_surf.

field.name: grid_type
field.documentation: Type of grid: 1=unstructured grid; 2=structured non-rectangular grid, here ndim11=ndim12=ndim13, ndim21=ndim22=ndim23, ndim31=ndim32=ndim33; 3=rectangular grid, where grid coordinates are stored in the vectors dim1(1:ndim1,1,1), dim2(1,1:ndim2,1), dim3(1,1,1:ndim3)

field.name: ngriddim
field.documentation: Number of grid dimension. For ngriddim=2 the grid is specified by dim1 and dim2 only, while dim3, dim4, dim5, dim6 can be ignored (should not be allocated). For ngriddim=3 also dim3 is used to describe the grid etc. E.g. if your distribution is given by the three variables the poloidal flux, perpendicular and parallel velocities, then ngriddim=3 and grid_coord(1)=15, grid_coord(1)=16, grid_coord(3)=6.

field.name: grid_coord
field.documentation: Identifies the coordinates specifies in dim1, dim2, dim3, dim4, dim5, and dim6. grid_coord(K) describes the coordinate representaed in dimK, for K=1,2...6. The possible coordinates are: 1=R, Major radius [m]; 2=Z, Vertical position [m]; 3=X, first cartesian coordinate in the horizontal plane [m]; 4=Y, second cartesian coordinate in the horizontal plane (grad(X) x grad(Y) = grad(Z)) [m]; 5=phi, toroidal angle [rad]; 6=psi, poloidal magnetic flux [T*m^2]; 7=rhotor, the square root of the toroidal flux; 8=theta, geometrical poloidal angle [rad]; 9=theta_b, Boozer poloidal angle [rad]; 10=vx, velocity in the x-direction [m/s]; 11=vy, velocity in the y-direction [m/s]; 12=vz, velocity in the z-direction [m/s]; 13=vel, total velocity [m/s]; 14=vphi, velocity in the phi-direction [m/s]; 15=vpar, velocity in the parallel direction [m/s]; 16=vperp, velocity in the perpendicular direction [m/s]; 17=E, Hamiltonian energy [J]; 18=Pphi, canonical toroidal angular momentum [kg m^2/s]; 19=mu, magnetic moment [J/T]; 20=Lambda=mu/E [1/T]; 21=pitch=vpar/v [-]; 22=s, the position of the omnigenous plane (generalised equitorial plane) as described by the fields omnigen_surf%s and omnigen_surf%rz; 23=particle spin; 24=n_Legendre, the index of the Legendre polynomial of the pitch, e.g. if the k:th component of dim3(1,1,k,1,1,1)=5 then this refer to the 5:th Legendre polynomial P_5(xi). Vector (6)

field.name: thin_orbits
field.documentation: Specifies if guiding centre orbits are thin. Note: only used for orbit averaged distribution functions. For thin_orbits=1 the orbit are considered thin, i.e. each orbit is bound to follow a single flux surface; for thin_orbits=0 the orbits are asumed to follow guiding centre trajectories. E.g. thin_orbits=0 using constants of motion as given in a generalised equitorial plane, then the orbit outside the equitorial plane are described by the guiding centre equations of motion.

field.name: topology
field.documentation: Description of the topology of the grid. NOTE: only used for nregion_topo>2.

field.name: omnigen_surf
field.documentation: List of omnigeuous magnetic surfaces to which the s-coordinates in grid_coord refer. NOTE: only used for gridcoord=3. NOTE: all guiding centre orbits intersect at least one omnigeuous (or stagnation) surfaces, i.e. the omnigeuous generalised the equitorial plane (the midplane). nsurfs=Number of omnigenous surfaces. Structure array(nregion_topo)

field.name: rz
field.documentation: (R,z) coordinates of the omnigeuous magnetic surfaces (generalised equitorial plane). NOTE: only used for gridcoord=3. Vector rz1d (nsurfs)

field.name: r
field.documentation: Major radius [m]

field.name: z
field.documentation: Altitude [m]

field.name: s
field.documentation: Coordinates which uniquely maps the omnigeuous magnetic surfaces (generalised equitorial plane). NOTE: only used for gridcoord=3. Vector (nsurfs)

field.name: topo_regions
field.documentation: List with distribution function in each topological region; Time-dependent. Structure array(nregion_topo)

field.name: ind_omnigen
field.documentation: Index of the omnigeuous magnetic surfaces (generalised equitorial plane) to which the s-coordinates refer. NOTE: only used for gridcoord=3.

field.name: dim1
field.documentation: First dimension in phase space; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim11, ndim21, ndim31, ndim41, ndim51, ndim61).

field.name: dim2
field.documentation: Second dimension in phase space; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim12, ndim22, ndim32, ndim42, ndim52, ndim62).

field.name: dim3
field.documentation: Third dimension in phase space; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim13, ndim23, ndim33, ndim43, ndim53, ndim63).

field.name: dim4
field.documentation: Fourth dimension in phase space; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim14, ndim24, ndim34, ndim44, ndim54, ndim64).

field.name: dim5
field.documentation: Fifth dimension in phase space; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim15, ndim25, ndim35, ndim45, ndim55, ndim65).

field.name: dim6
field.documentation: Sixth dimension in phase space; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim16, ndim26, ndim36, ndim46, ndim56, ndim66).

field.name: jacobian
field.documentation: Jacobian of the transformation of the phase space grid variables; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim11, ndim22, ndim33, ndim44, ndim55, ndim66).

field.name: distfunc
field.documentation: Orbit (or bounce) averaged distribution function given on a grid [1/m^3 (m/s)^-3]; Time-dependent; Array6d(ndim11, ndim22, ndim33, ndim44, ndim55, ndim66).

field.name: f_expansion
field.documentation: Distribution function, f, expanded into a vector of successive approximations. The first element in the vector (f_expansion(1)) is the zeroth order distribution function, while the K:th element in the vector (f_expansion(K)) is the K:th correction, such that the total distribution function is a sum over all elements in the f_expansion vector. Time-dependent. Structure array(Nf_expansion)

field.name: grid
field.documentation: Grid for storing the distribution function. Time-dependent; Complexgrid

field.name: uid
field.documentation: Unique index of this grid. Used for handling multiple grids

field.name: id
field.documentation: Name / identifier string for this grid

field.name: spaces
field.documentation: Definitions of grid spaces. Array of structures (number of spaces)

field.name: geotype
field.documentation: Type of space geometry (id flags). Flags defining how the geometry (objects.geo) fields associated with; space objects are to be interpreted. Array (number of geometries defined for this space),; first dimension: geometry index. A flag value of GRID_UNDEFINED=0 indicates the standard interpretation for; the given coordinates.

field.name: geotypeid
field.documentation: Type of space geometries (id string). See geotype.

field.name: coordtype
field.documentation: Type of coordinates describing the physical space. Vector (number of space dimensions); The size of coordtype defines the dimension of the space.; For predefined integer constants for standard coordinates see; the documentation of the grid service library.

field.name: objects
field.documentation: Definition of the space objects.; Array of structures (dimension of highest-dimensional objects).; First dimension: dimension of the objects (1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes, ...)

field.name: boundary
field.documentation: Lists of (n-1)-dimensional space objects defining the boundary of an n-dimensional space object.; Matrix(number of objects of dimension n, maximum number of boundary objects).; First dimension: object index, second dimension: boundary object index

field.name: neighbour
field.documentation: Connectivity information. Array (number of objects, maximum number of boundaries per object, maximum number of neighbours per boundary).; Stores the indices of the n-dimensional objects adjacent to the given n-dimensional object.;An object can possibly have multiple neighbours on every boundary.; First dimension: object index, second dimension: boundary index, third dimension: neighbour index on the boundary.

field.name: geo
field.documentation: Geometry data matrix associated with every object. Float array (number of objects, number of geometry coeff. 1, number of geometry coeff. 2, number of geometries).; The exact definition depends on the geometry type of the space (complexgrid_space.geotype).; First dimension: object index, second+third dimension: geometry coefficient matrix row+column, third dimension: geometry index (for definition of multiple geometries).

field.name: measure
field.documentation: Measure of space objects, i.e. physical size (length for 1d, area for 2d, volume for 3d objects,...). [m^dim].; First dimension: object index, second dimension: geometry index

field.name: xpoints
field.documentation: List of indices of all nodes which are x-points. Vector (number of x-points)

field.name: subgrids
field.documentation: Definitions of subgrids. Array of structures (number of subgrids)

field.name: id
field.documentation: ID string (name) of the subgrid.

field.name: list
field.documentation: List of object lists. Array of structures (number of object lists).

field.name: cls
field.documentation: Class tuple of the grid objects in this object list. Vector (number of grid spaces)

field.name: indset
field.documentation: Implicit list of the object indices.; Array of structures (number of grid spaces = length of index tuple). Every index of the index tuple is described by an index set, which defines either a list of index values or a range of index values.

field.name: range
field.documentation: Defines an index range enumerating from range[1] to range[2] (with both range[1] and range[2] included). If additionally a third value range(3) is given, it is used as a stride. If it is omitted, a stride of 1 is assumed. Vector(3)

field.name: ind
field.documentation: An explicit list of indices. If this member is defined and has nonzero size, the list is assumed to be explicit. Vector(length of explicit index list)

field.name: ind
field.documentation: Explicit list of index tuples. Matrix (number of objects, number of spaces in grid).; First dimension: object index, second dimension: index tuple/space index.; If this field is defined and has nonzero size, the object list is understood to be explicit.

field.name: metric
field.documentation: Metric coefficients

field.name: measure
field.documentation: Measure of object, i.e. physical size (length for 1d, area for 2d, volume for 3d objects). [m^dim].; Use this field to store measures of implicitly defined grid objects.; Array of structures (number of subgrids this information is stored on)

field.name: griduid
field.documentation: Unique identifier of the grid this scalar quantity is associated with.

field.name: subgrid
field.documentation: Index of the subgrid (as stored in grid.subgrids) the data is stored on.

field.name: scalar
field.documentation: Scalar representation of data. One scalar entry is stored per object in the subgrid.; The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float Vector(nobjects_subgrid). First dimension: object index.

field.name: vector

field.name: geo
field.documentation: Geometry data for implicit objects

field.name: geotype
field.documentation: Type of geometry (id flag). A flag defining how the geometry data associated with grid objects is to be interpreted. If the field is undefined (0=GRID_UNDEFINED), the standard interpretation for; the given coordinate types is assumed.

field.name: geotypeid
field.documentation: Type of geometry (id string).

field.name: coordtype
field.documentation: Type of coordinates describing the physical space. Vector (number of space dimensions); The size of coordtype defines the dimension of the space.; For predefined integer constants for standard coordinates see; the documentation of the grid service library.

field.name: geo_matrix
field.documentation: Geometry data matrix associated with implicit objects. Array of structures (number of subgrids this information is stored on); The exact definition of the stored values depends on the geometry type of the geometry complexgrid_geo_global.geotype;

field.documentation: Index of the subgrid (as stored in grid.subgrids) the data is stored on.

field.documentation: Label describing the data

field.documentation: Components of the vector. Array of structures (number of vector components). Time-dependent; FIXME: inherit time-dependence for this element

field.name: align
field.documentation: Alignment flag for vector components. Integer vector (number of vector components).

field.name: alignid
field.documentation: Alignment id for vector components. String vector (number of vector components).

field.name: basis
field.documentation: Index of basis (defined in associated grid) this vector is aligned to; If set to GRID_UNDEFINED=0, the canonical basis of the default coordinates of the grid assumed.

field.name: values
field.documentation: Values of the distribution function [m^-3 (m/s)^-3]. Time-dependent; Complexgrid_scalar.

field.name: input_src
field.documentation: Input sources of particles and power for the distribution species (to aid diagnosing the code output).

field.name: particle_src
field.documentation: Particle source

field.name: total
field.documentation: Total source of particles and power (NBI, fusion products, pellets etc.)

field.name: particles
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [1/s]; Time-dependedent

field.name: power
field.documentation: Power associated with the source/sink of particles [W]; Time-dependent

field.name: torque
field.documentation: Torque due to the source/sink of particles [N.m]; Time-dependent

field.name: volume_intgr
field.documentation: Volume integrated source of particles and power (NBI, fusion products, pellets etc.)

field.name: particles
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [1/s]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: power
field.documentation: Power associated with the source/sink of particles [W]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: torque
field.documentation: Torque due to the source/sink of particles [N.m]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: flux_surf_av
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged source of particles and power (NBI, fusion products, pellets etc.)

field.name: particlesd
field.documentation: Source/sink particles [s^-1 m^-3]; Time-dependedent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: powerd
field.documentation: Power density associated with the source/sink of particles [W.m^-3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: torqued
field.documentation: Torque density due to the source/sink of particles [N.m^-2]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: wave_src
field.documentation: Auxiliary wave absorbed by the distribution species

field.name: type
field.documentation: Wave type (LH, EC, IC, ...), can be a combination of these if several wave types are absorbed by this species.

field.name: wave_power
field.documentation: Auxiliary wave power absorbed by the distribution species [W]; Time-dependent.

field.name: wave_powerd
field.documentation: Auxiliary flux surface averaged wave power density absorbed by the distribution species [W/m^3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: nucl_reac
field.documentation: Information on nuclear reactions involving the calculated species.

field.name: point_reac
field.documentation: Pointer to a species in composition who can undergo a nuclear reaction with the calculated species; Vector (nreac)

field.name: id_reac
field.documentation: Identification of the reaction between the calculated species and a background species (including which branch if applicable); Time-dependent; Vector (nreac). Table defining the index of reactions to be provided.

field.name: codeparam
field.documentation: Code parameters

field.name: codename
field.documentation: Name of the code

field.name: codeversion
field.documentation: Version of the code (as in the ITM repository)

field.name: parameters
field.documentation: List of the code specific parameters, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_diag
field.documentation: List of the code specific diagnostic/output, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_flag
field.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values meaning some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used. Exact rules could discussed and implemented in the module wrapper. Time-dependent.

field.name: codeparam
field.documentation: Code parameters

field.name: codename
field.documentation: Name of the code

field.name: codeversion
field.documentation: Version of the code (as in the ITM repository)

field.name: parameters
field.documentation: List of the code specific parameters, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_diag
field.documentation: List of the code specific diagnostic/output, string expected to be in XML format.

field.name: output_flag
field.documentation: Output flag : 0 means the run is successful, other values meaning some difficulty has been encountered, the exact meaning is then code specific. Negative values mean the result shall not be used. Exact rules could discussed and implemented in the module wrapper. Time-dependent.

field.name: time
field.documentation: Time [s]; Time-dependent; Scalar

CPO.documentation: Sources of particles for input to kinetic equations, e.g. Fokker-Planck calculation. The sources could originate from e.g. NBI or fusion reactions. Time-dependent CPO

field.name: datainfo
field.documentation: Generic information on a data item

field.name: dataprovider
field.documentation: Name of the actual data provider (the person who filled the data)

field.name: putdate
field.documentation: Date at which the data has been put in the DB

field.name: source
field.documentation: Exact reference of the data source (e.g. original reference in the native machine data base)

field.name: comment
field.documentation: Any additional comment

field.name: cocos
field.documentation: COordinates COnventionS followed by this CPO

field.name: id
field.documentation: CPO id for checking its provenance in the workflow

field.name: isref
field.documentation: 1 if the data can be found in the present data base entry; 2 if the data can be found in a parent data base entry; 0 if no data consistent with the present entry can be found.

field.name: whatref
field.documentation: Structure defining a database entry and the CPO occurrence

field.name: user
field.documentation: Name of the user if private data, public if public ITM database.

field.name: machine
field.documentation: Name of the device

field.name: shot
field.documentation: Shot number

field.name: run
field.documentation: Run number

field.name: occurrence
field.documentation: Occurrence number of the CPO in the reference entry

field.name: putinfo
field.documentation: Level 2 information describing how to retrieve the actual data for the UAL. Not to be filled/used by the ITM user !

field.name: putmethod
field.documentation: Storage method for this data

field.name: putaccess
field.documentation: Instructions to access the data using this method

field.name: putlocation
field.documentation: Name of this data under this method

field.name: rights
field.documentation: Access rights to this data

field.name: composition
field.documentation: Plasma composition (description of ion species).

field.name: amn
field.documentation: Atomic mass number (lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: zn
field.documentation: Nuclear charge (lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: zion
field.documentation: Ion charge (of the dominant ionisation state; lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: imp_flag
field.documentation: Multiple charge state calculation flag : 0-Only one charge state is considered; 1-Multiple charge state are considered and are described in impurity CPO; Vector (nion)

field.name: label
field.documentation: Label for the ions - note the charge state is not included; String Vector (nion)

field.name: compositions
field.documentation: Contains detailed information on the plasma composition (main ions, impurities, neutrals, edge species).

field.name: nuclei
field.documentation: Array of nuclei considered.

field.name: zn
field.documentation: Nuclear charge [units of elementary charge];

field.name: amn
field.documentation: Mass of atom [amu]

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying element (e.g. H, D, T, He, C, ...)

field.name: ions
field.documentation: Array of main plasma ions.

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: zion
field.documentation: Ion charge (of the dominant ionisation state; lumped ions are allowed); Vector (nion)

field.name: imp_flag
field.documentation: Multiple charge state calculation flag : 0-Only one charge state is considered; 1-Multiple charge state are considered and are described in impurity CPO; Vector (nion)

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying ion (e.g. H+, D+, T+, He+2, C+, ...)

field.name: impurities
field.documentation: Array of impurities.

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: i_ion
field.documentation: Index of the impurity species in the coreprof ion species ordering. Vector (nimp)

field.name: nzimp
field.documentation: Number of charge states (or bundles) considered for this impurity species.

field.name: zmin
field.documentation: Minimum Z of impurity ionisation state bundle. Vector (nzimp)

field.name: zmax
field.documentation: Maximum Z of impurity ionisation state bundle. If no bundle, zmax=zmin. Vector (nzimp)

field.name: label
field.documentation: String array (nzimp) identifying impurities (e.g. C+, C+2 , C+3, C+4, C+5, C+6, ...)

field.name: neutralscomp
field.documentation: Array of neutrals.

field.name: neutcomp
field.documentation: Array of components to the atom or molecule. Vector (ncomp)

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: multiplicity
field.documentation: Multiplicity of the atom; int

field.name: type
field.documentation: Type of neutral, in terms of energy : 0=cold, 1=thermal, 2= fast, 3=NBI. Vector (ntype) of identifiers

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying the atom or molecule (e.g. D2, DT, CD4, ...)

field.name: edgespecies
field.documentation: Array of edge species.

field.name: nucindex
field.documentation: Index into list of nuclei; int

field.name: zmin
field.documentation: Minimum Z of species charge state bundle

field.name: zmax
field.documentation: Maximum Z of species charge state bundle

field.name: label
field.documentation: String identifying the species (e.g. D0, D+, C0, C+, C+2, ...)

field.name: signature
field.documentation: Identifier for species choices. The goal of this is to uniquely capture the species blocks so that if the signatures are the same then the species blocks will also be the same.

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: source
field.documentation: Source. Time-dependent. Structure array(nsrc_spec)

field.name: source_id
field.documentation: List of identifiers for the source, in term the type and name of the injectors and reactions that provide the source, along with an index separating sources with the same name and type. Possible content for type: NBI or reaction names (see specifications on the ITM webpages); the field name should either be taken from nbi(*)%nbi_unit(*)%name, or describe the populations involved in the reaction, e.g. fast-thermal; the field index should separate different sources generated from a single injector or reaction. Vector(n_injectors_and_reactions)

field.name: type
field.documentation: Identify the type of the object or process.

field.name: id
field.documentation: Short string identifier

field.name: flag
field.documentation: Integer identifier

field.name: description
field.documentation: Verbose description of identifier

field.name: name
field.documentation: The name of the object or process. Here the object should be an instans of the type specified in the field type.

field.name: index
field.documentation: Index the separating objects or processes with the same name.

field.name: src_spec
field.documentation: Pointer to the source species whose characteristics are given in composition.

field.name: gyro_type
field.documentation: Defines how to interpret the spatial coordinates: 1 = given at the actual particle birth point; 2 =given at the gyro centre of the birth point.

field.name: global_param
field.documentation: Global parameters.

field.name: src_pow
field.documentation: Total power source [W]; Time-dependent.

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: abserror
field.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: relerror
field.documentation: Relative error on signal (normalised to signal value); Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: src_rate
field.documentation: Particle source rate [1/s]; Time-dependent.

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: abserror
field.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: relerror
field.documentation: Relative error on signal (normalised to signal value); Time-dependent; Scalar

field.name: profiles_1d
field.documentation: 1D radial profiles

field.name: rho_tor_norm
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal flux coordinate at the grid points for 1D profiles; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: rho_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate at the grid points for 1D profiles [m]. Defined as sqrt(phi/pi/B0), where B0 = equilibrium/global_param/toroid_field/b0. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: psi
field.documentation: Poloidal flux at the grid points for 1D profiles [Wb], without 1/2pi and such that Bp=|grad psi| /R/2/pi. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: pow_den
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged power density [W/m^3]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Vector

field.name: abserror
field.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Vector

field.name: relerror
field.documentation: Relative error on signal (normalised to signal value); Time-dependent; Vector

field.name: src_rate
field.documentation: Flux surface averaged total source density of particles [m^-3 s^-1]; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Vector

field.name: abserror
field.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Vector

field.name: relerror
field.documentation: Relative error on signal (normalised to signal value); Time-dependent; Vector

field.name: profiles_2d
field.documentation: 2D source profiles in terms of two phase space coordinates

field.name: grid_coord
field.documentation: Identifies the coordinates specifies in dim1 and dim2. grid_coord(1) and grid_coord(2) describe the coordinate represented in dim1 and dim2. The possible coordinates are: 1=R, Major radius [m]; 2=Z, Vertical position [m]; 3=X, first cartesian coordinate in the horizontal plane [m]; 4=Y, second cartesian coordinate in the horizontal plane (grad(X) x grad(Y) = grad(Z)) [m]; 5=phi, toroidal angle [rad]; 6=psi, poloidal magnetic flux [T*m^2]; 7=rhotor, the square root of the toroidal flux; 8=theta, geometrical poloidal angle [rad]; 9=theta_b, Boozer poloidal angle [rad]; 10=vx, velocity in the x-direction [m/s]; 11=vy, velocity in the y-direction [m/s]; 12=vz, velocity in the z-direction [m/s]; 13=vel, total velocity [m/s]; 14=vphi, velocity in the phi-direction [m/s]; 15=vpar, velocity in the parallel direction [m/s]; 16=vperp, velocity in the perpendicular direction [m/s]; 17=E, Hamiltonian energy [J]; 18=Pphi, canonical toroidal angular momentum [kg m^2/s]; 19=mu, magnetic moment [J/T]; 20=Lambda=mu/E [1/T]. Vector (2)

field.name: dim1
field.documentation: First coordinate of 2D grid. Time-dependent; Vector (ndim1,ndim2)

field.name: dim2
field.documentation: Second coordinate of 2D grid. Time-dependent; Vector (ndim1,ndim2)

field.name: g11
field.documentation: 11 component of the covariant metric tensor in the (dim1, dim2) coordiante system. Time-dependent; Vector (ndim1,ndim2)

field.name: g12
field.documentation: 12 component of the covariant metric tensor in the (dim1, dim2) coordiante system. Time-dependent; Vector (ndim1,ndim2)

field.name: g21
field.documentation: 21 component of the covariant metric tensor in the (dim1, dim2) coordiante system. Time-dependent; Vector (ndim1,ndim2)

field.name: g22
field.documentation: 22 component of the covariant metric tensor in the (dim1, dim2) coordiante system. Time-dependent; Vector (ndim1,ndim2)

field.name: pow_den
field.documentation: Source power density. Here sum(M,N=1,2; pow_den*gNM*dimN*dimM) have unit [W]. Time-dependent; Vector (ndim1,ndim2)

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Matrix

field.name: abserror
field.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Matrix

field.name: relerror
field.documentation: Relative error on signal (normalised to signal value); Time-dependent; Matrix

field.name: src_rate
field.documentation: Source density of particles.Here sum(M,N=1,2; src_rate*gNM*dimN*dimM) have unit [1/s]. Time-dependent; Vector (ndim1,ndim2)

field.name: value
field.documentation: Signal value; Time-dependent; Matrix

field.name: abserror
field.documentation: Absolute error on signal; Time-dependent; Matrix

field.name: relerror
field.documentation: Relative error on signal (normalised to signal value); Time-dependent; Matrix

field.name: line_srcprof
field.documentation: 1D profiles representation of a line source; Time-dependent

field.name: rho_tor
field.documentation: Toroidal flux coordinate at the grid points for 1D profiles [m]. Defined as sqrt(phi/pi/B0), where B0 = equilibrium/global_param/toroid_field/b0. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: rho_tor_norm
field.documentation: Normalised toroidal flux coordinate at the grid points for 1D profiles; Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: psi
field.documentation: Poloidal flux at the grid points for 1D profiles [Wb], without 1/2pi and such that Bp = |grad psi| / (R 2 pi). Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: R
field.documentation: Major radius at the line source. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: Z
field.documentation: Vertical position of the line source. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: theta
field.documentation: Polidal angle [rad]. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: theta_id
field.documentation: Type of poloidal angle: 1 : same as the poloidal angle in the equlibrium cpo; 2 : geometrical polar angle, tan(theta) = Z/(R-R_0); 3 : other. If option 3, a transformation to the geometrical poloidal angle is provided in th2th_pol.

field.name: th2th_pol
field.documentation: Geometrical poloidal angle at grid points in theta, i.e. the transformation from theta to the polar poloidal angle; used only if angl_type=3; Time-dependent; Matrix (ndim1, ndim2)

field.name: pitch
field.documentation: Pitch (i.e. v_parallel/v) of source particles. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: energy
field.documentation: Kinetic energy of source particles [eV]. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: ang_momentum
field.documentation: Kinetic angular momentum of a single source particles, R m v_phi [Nms]. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: src_rate
field.documentation: Source density of particles [1/m^3/s]. Time-dependent; Vector (npsi)

field.name: source_rate
field.documentation: Source density of particles in phase space (real space, velocity space, spin state).

field.name: grid
field.documentation: Grid for storing the source-rate. Time-dependent; Complexgrid

field.name: uid
field.documentation: Unique index of this grid. Used for handling multiple grids

field.name: id
field.documentation: Name / identifier string for this grid

field.name: spaces
field.documentation: Definitions of grid spaces. Array of structures (number of spaces)

field.name: geotype
field.documentation: Type of space geometry (id flags). Flags defining how the geometry (objects.geo) fields associated with; space objects are to be interpreted. Array (number of geometries defined for this space),; first dimension: geometry index. A flag value of GRID_UNDEFINED=0 indicates the standard interpretation for; the given coordinates.

field.name: geotypeid
field.documentation: Type of space geometries (id string). See geotype.

field.name: coordtype
field.documentation: Type of coordinates describing the physical space. Vector (number of space dimensions); The size of coordtype defines the dimension of the space.; For predefined integer constants for standard coordinates see; the documentation of the grid service library.

field.name: objects
field.documentation: Definition of the space objects.; Array of structures (dimension of highest-dimensional objects).; First dimension: dimension of the objects (1=nodes, 2=edges, 3=faces, 4=cells/volumes, ...)

field.name: boundary
field.documentation: Lists of (n-1)-dimensional space objects defining the boundary of an n-dimensional space object.; Matrix(number of objects of dimension n, maximum number of boundary objects).; First dimension: object index, second dimension: boundary object index

field.name: neighbour
field.documentation: Connectivity information. Array (number of objects, maximum number of boundaries per object, maximum number of neighbours per boundary).; Stores the indices of the n-dimensional objects adjacent to the given n-dimensional object.;An object can possibly have multiple neighbours on every boundary.; First dimension: object index, second dimension: boundary index, third dimension: neighbour index on the boundary.

field.name: geo
field.documentation: Geometry data matrix associated with every object. Float array (number of objects, number of geometry coeff. 1, number of geometry coeff. 2, number of geometries).; The exact definition depends on the geometry type of the space (complexgrid_space.geotype).; First dimension: object index, second+third dimension: geometry coefficient matrix row+column, third dimension: geometry index (for definition of multiple geometries).

field.name: measure
field.documentation: Measure of space objects, i.e. physical size (length for 1d, area for 2d, volume for 3d objects,...). [m^dim].; First dimension: object index, second dimension: geometry index

field.name: xpoints
field.documentation: List of indices of all nodes which are x-points. Vector (number of x-points)

field.name: subgrids
field.documentation: Definitions of subgrids. Array of structures (number of subgrids)

field.name: id
field.documentation: ID string (name) of the subgrid.

field.name: list
field.documentation: List of object lists. Array of structures (number of object lists).

field.name: cls
field.documentation: Class tuple of the grid objects in this object list. Vector (number of grid spaces)

field.name: indset
field.documentation: Implicit list of the object indices.; Array of structures (number of grid spaces = length of index tuple). Every index of the index tuple is described by an index set, which defines either a list of index values or a range of index values.

field.name: range
field.documentation: Defines an index range enumerating from range[1] to range[2] (with both range[1] and range[2] included). If additionally a third value range(3) is given, it is used as a stride. If it is omitted, a stride of 1 is assumed. Vector(3)

field.name: ind
field.documentation: An explicit list of indices. If this member is defined and has nonzero size, the list is assumed to be explicit. Vector(length of explicit index list)

field.name: ind
field.documentation: Explicit list of index tuples. Matrix (number of objects, number of spaces in grid).; First dimension: object index, second dimension: index tuple/space index.; If this field is defined and has nonzero size, the object list is understood to be explicit.

field.name: metric
field.documentation: Metric coefficients

field.name: measure
field.documentation: Measure of object, i.e. physical size (length for 1d, area for 2d, volume for 3d objects). [m^dim].; Use this field to store measures of implicitly defined grid objects.; Array of structures (number of subgrids this information is stored on)

field.name: griduid
field.documentation: Unique identifier of the grid this scalar quantity is associated with.

field.name: subgrid
field.documentation: Index of the subgrid (as stored in grid.subgrids) the data is stored on.

field.name: scalar
field.documentation: Scalar representation of data. One scalar entry is stored per object in the subgrid.; The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float Vector(nobjects_subgrid). First dimension: object index.

field.name: vector
field.documentation: Vector representation of data. One vector is stored per object in the subgrid. The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; Float matrix(nobjects_subgrid, ndata).First dimension: object index, second dimension: index of data vector.

field.name: matrix
field.documentation: Matrix representation of data. One matrix is stored per object in the subgrid. The order is implicitly defined by the subgrid.; 3d float array(nobjects_subgrid,ndata1,ndata2). First dimension: object index, second dimension: matrix row, third dimension: matrix column.

field.name: g11
field.documentation: Metric coefficients g11. Array of structures (number of subgrids this information is stored on)
